result.execSummary:
The defendant Prince Antonio Gibbs Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court costs, victim witness surcharges and DNA surcharge are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 2/28/2020.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Restitution set at zero.

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after one (1) year and six (6) months of Initial Confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.

Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program.
Successfully complete a parenting program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.  No alcohol or controlled substances.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  To be served in Wisconsin State Prison system.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Prince Antonio Gibbs in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Prince Antonio Gibbs in custody.  Phyllis M. DeCarvalho appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by: Trevor E.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 147 days.
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence. This sentence is to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison system.
-6 month drivers license suspension as to Count 2
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 1 year and 6 months of Initial Confinement.
-Restitution set at zero
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 2/28/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 2/28/2020; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Attorney Mark S Rosen in court, defendant Prince Antonio Gibbs not in court, in custody.  Phyllis M. DeCarvalho appeared for the State of Wisconsin./SAB
Defendant is in LaCrosse County jail and was not produced. Case rescheduled for SENTENCING on 8/28/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Attorney Mark S Rosen in court.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant was not produced from La Crosse County Jail.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing.  Parties have been notified that effective August 3, 2014, this case is reassigned to Judge J.D. Watts, Branch 15, Room G-55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Prince Antonio Gibbs in court with attorney Mark S Rosen.  Defendant Prince Antonio Gibbs in custody.  Kevin R Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 1 & 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Count 3 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 44.

Defendant Prince Antonio Gibbs in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Defendant Prince Antonio Gibbs in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pled not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNT 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
